Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: compact body
The body of the small dragon is compact and lightweight, and is covered in smooth scales.
The body of the small dragon is compact and lightweight, and is covered in smooth scales.
hooked claws
The dragon's claws are hooked so that it can grip things with ease.
small silvery sapphire dragon

This dragon is roughly the size of a large hawk. It is covered in smooth, fiery-orange scales that are hardened over the dorsal side of the dragon, but are softer at the underside. It has four limbs; two legs and a pair of webbed wings extending from the shoulders. The eyes of this creature are a bright golden yellow with thin black slits for pupils, and are set below a pair of curved horns. A row of black spines cascade down the dragon's back to the tip of its tail.

This dragon is roughly the size of a large hawk. It is covered in smooth, fiery-orange scales that are hardened over the dorsal side of the dragon, but are softer at the underside. It has four limbs; two legs and a pair of webbed wings extending from the shoulders. The eyes of this creature are a bright golden yellow with thin black slits for pupils, and are set below a pair of curved horns. A row of black spines cascade down the dragon's back to the tip of its tail.
bright gold eyes
The dragon's eyes are a bright golden yellow color with thin slits of black for pupils.
The dragon's eyes are a bright golden yellow color with thin slits of black for pupils.
wedge-shaped head
The dragon's head is wedge-shaped and consists of two eyes, a pair of horns, and a mouth full of sharp teeth. Two holes dip into the sides of the head to serve as ears.
curved horns
A pair of curved horns set on the dragon's head. They are black and are ram-like.
left webbed wing

The left wing of this small dragon protrude from its left shoulder and extends outward at a length equal to the dragon's own body, head to tail. There are three long fingers connected by thin, leathery skin that also connects to the rear of the body, where the tail meets the body. At the front of the wing are the fingers link, a sharp thumb claw curves out from the wing.
The left wing of this small dragon protrude from its right shoulder and extends outward at a length equal to the dragon's own body, head to tail.
lean left leg
The dragon's legs are lean and muscular enough to support it's body when perching.
The dragon's legs are lean and muscular enough to support it's body when perching.
lean right leg
The dragon's legs are lean and muscular enough to support it's body when perching.
The dragon's legs are lean and muscular enough to support it's body when perching.
lean legs
The dragon's legs are lean and muscular enough to support it's body when perching.
The dragon's legs are lean and muscular enough to support it's body when perching.
mouth
A mouth full of sharp teeth and houses a forked tongue.
neck
The neck, which supports the dragon's head.
right webbed wing

The right wing of this small dragon protrude from its right shoulder and extends outward at a length equal to the dragon's own body, head to tail. There are three long fingers connected by thin, leathery skin that also connects to the rear of the body, where the tail meets the body. At the front of the wing are the fingers link, a sharp thumb claw curves out from the wing.
The right wing of this small dragon protrude from its shoulders and extend outward at a length equal to the dragon's own body, head to tail.
smooth scales
Its scales are smooth and a vibrant fiery-orange color and cover the dragon entirely. They are harder along the dorsal side of the dragon, while softer along the underside.
Its scales are smooth and a vibrant fiery-orange color and cover the dragon entirely. They are harder along the dorsal side of the dragon, while softer along the underside.
sharp spines
The sharp spines of the dragon that run along the dragon's neck, back and tail. They lie flat against its body unless it is angry, then they are raised.
a small fiery-orange dragon's spined tail
A long tail covered in short, black spines that can be made to rest against the scales when in passive mode.
A long tail covered in short, black spines that can be made to rest against the scales when in passive mode.
serrated teeth
Within the dragon's mouth are multiple rows of serrated teeth. You don't want to get bit by it!
forked tongue
The forked tongue of the dragon occasionally flicks into the air like a snake.
webbed wings

The wings of this small dragon protrude from its shoulders and extend outward at a length equal to the dragon's own body, head to tail. There are three long fingers connected by thin, leathery skin that also connects to the rear of the body, where the tail meets the body. At the front of the wing are the fingers link, a sharp thumb claw curves out from the wing.
